description: In Madagascar, as of March 21, all schools, universities, and administrative offices will be closed.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: In Madagascar, as of March 21, all schools, universities, and administrative offices will be closed.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: The government announced that all schools in the Analamanga region are closed. The policy began on July 6th for 15 days.

description: The government announced that all schools in the Analamanga region are closed. The policy began on July 6th for 15 days.

description: In Madagascar, as of March 23, 2020, only shops selling basic goods will remain open : supermarkets, grocery stores, and neighborhood markets between the hours of 6 a.m. to 12 p.m.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: In Madagascar, as of March 23, 2020, a curfew is in place between 8 p.m. and 5 a.m. in Antananarivo (Analamanga region) and Toamasina.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, a strict curfew is in place between 8 pm to 5 am for all regions. UPDATE: Strict curfew between 8 pm and 5 am now applies to all of Madagascar.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: The government of Madagascar has imposed a new curfew on the Analamanga region. Curfew is between 8 pm to 4 am.
On 21 March the Government of Madagascar declared a Health State of Emergency (set to last two weeks, but extendable).
In Madagascar, as of April 3,2020, all of Madagascar is in a State of Health Emergency.

As of May 30, 2020, the Government of Madagascar has extended its previous (April 3, 2020)  State of Health Emergency another 14 days. UPDATE: On May 30, 2020, the Government of Madagascar extended the previous (April 3, 2020) State of Health Emergency another 14 days.

In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, the State of Health Emergency has been extended for another 15 days. UPDATE: President Rajoelina of Madagascar has extended the State of Health Emergency for another 15 days.
Cruise ships will not be permitted to berth in Madagascar's ports for 30 days from 15 March.
Madagascar is enforcing a suspension of all international air travel starting from March 20, for 30 days.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: In Madagascar, as of April 10, 2020, everyone must wear a face mask (or scarf that covers one's mouth and nose) while in the capital of Antananarivo. Anyone caught outside without a mask on will be detained by the police.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: In Madagascar, as of April 5,2020, more hand washing stations will be placed around the cities of Antananarivo, Toamasina, and Fianarantsoa (cities with more than 5 confirmed COVID-19 cases).
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: Madagascar donated health resources to Comoros to assist its fight against Covid-19.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
Chad has received it official donation of Tambavy Covid-Organics [CVO] from the government delegation of Madagascar. They were transported by special aircraft. 
Chad received its order of 20,000 doses of CVO, the remedy is intended to be distributed to all the provinces of chad.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: In Madagascar, effective March 23, 2020, health checkpoints are to be set up at the Antananarivo city limits and around large cities across the country.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
target_city: Antananarivo, other large cities across the country

description: In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, door-to-door testing will be conducted for suspected cases.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: In Madagascar, as of March 23, 2020, all public transportation, urban, suburban and national, is suspended in Antananarivo (Analamanga region) and Toamasina.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: All access to the Analamanga region is closed, and health barriers are reinforced.
In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, stay-at-home measures continue indefinitely. Everyone has been asked to stay inside except in emergency situations.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: In Madagascar, as of March 26,2020, confinement measures have been put in place in order to curb the communal spread of COVID-19. Everyone has been asked to stay inside except in emergency situations.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: In Madagascar, as of March 28,2020, per the latest State of Emergency requirements, strict confinement measures are in place starting at 12 pm. only those with valid authorization will be allowed to move around outside.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: The government of Madagascar announced that all districts and regions are to resume all activities, except for 5 areas (the district of Toamasina I and II, Fénérive-Est, Moramanga, and the Analamanga region.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: In Madagascar, as of March 26, 2020, confinement measures have been put in place in order to curb the communal spread of COVID-19. Everyone has been asked to stay inside except in emergency situations.
In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, stay-at-home measures continue indefinitely. UPDATE: Confinement measures announced on March 26th continue indefinitely.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: In Madagascar, as of March 23, 2020, only shops selling basic goods will remain open: supermarkets, grocery stores, and neighborhood markets (open between 6 a.m. to 12 p.m.) Only one person per household may do the shopping - this can be arranged with the Commune and drugstores, gas stations and banks will remain open.

In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, all schools, churches, and all public spaces (bars, restaurants, shops, karaokes, etc.) will remain closed until April 19th. UPDATE: The initial closure did not specify an end date but the government of Madagascar has now closed schools, churches, and all public spaces (bars, restaurants, shops, karaokes, etc.) until April 19th.

The government of Madagascar has announced that all economic activities in the districts of Toamasina I and II, Fénérive Est, and Moramanga are allowed until 3 p.m., except for vulnerable people (people with diabetes, hypertension, asthma, kidney disease)

The government of Madagascar has announced that  economic activities in Analamanga region are allowed until 5 p.m., except for vulnerable people (people with diabetes, hypertension, asthma, kidney disease, etc.)
The government of Madagascar announced on September 6, 2020, that museums and exhibition halls can reopen and welcome up to 100 people at a time.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Madagascar, as of March 21, 2020, all churches, event spaces, bars and restaurants, sporting fixtures and cultural events are closed or cancelled.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, no public gatherings of more than 50 people are allowed (family gatherings, etc.).
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
